jokes.author: Tim Vine
jokes.text: I've decided to sell my Hoover... well it was just collecting dust.

jokes.author: Masai Graham
jokes.text: I've written a joke about a fat badger but I couldn't fit it into my set.

jokes.author: Mark Watson
jokes.text: Always leave them wanting more my uncle used to say to me. Which is why he lost his job in disaster relief.

jokes.author: Bec Hill
jokes.text: I was given some Sudoku toilet paper. It didn't work. You could only fill it in with number ones and number twos.

jokes.author: Ria Lina
jokes.text: I wanted to do a show about feminism. But my husband wouldn't let me.

jokes.author: Paul F Taylor
jokes.text: Money can't buy you happiness? Well check this out I bought myself a Happy Meal.

jokes.author: Scott Capurro
jokes.text: Scotland had oil but it's running out thanks to all that deep frying.

jokes.author: Jason Cook
jokes.text: I've been married for 10 years I haven't made a decision for seven.

jokes.author: Felicity Ward
jokes.text: This show is about perception and perspective. But it depends how you look at it.

jokes.author: Masai Graham
jokes.text: I've written a joke about a fat badger but I couldn't fit it into my set.

jokes.author: Rob Auton
jokes.text: I heard a rumour that Cadbury is bringing out an oriental chocolate bar. Could be a Chinese Wispa.

jokes.author: Alex Horne
jokes.text: I used to work in a shoe-recycling shop. It was sole-destroying.

jokes.author: Alfie Moore
jokes.text: I'm in a same-sex marriage... the sex is always the same.

jokes.author: Tim Vine
jokes.text: My friend told me he was going to a fancy dress party as an Italian island. I said to him 'Don't be Sicily'.

jokes.author: Gary Delaney
jokes.text: I can give you the cause of anaphylactic shock in a nutshell.

jokes.author: Phil Wang
jokes.text: The Pope is a lot like Doctor Who. He never dies just keeps being replaced by white men.

jokes.author: Marcus Brigstocke
jokes.text: You know you are fat when you hug a child and it gets lost.

jokes.author: Liam Williams
jokes.text: The universe implodes. No matter.

jokes.author: Bobby Mair
jokes.text: I was adopted at birth and have never met my mum. That makes it very difficult to enjoy any lapdance.

jokes.author: Chris Coltrane
jokes.text: The good thing about lending someone your time machine is that you basically get it back immediately.

jokes.author: Stewart Francis
jokes.text: You know who really gives kids a bad name? Posh and Becks.

jokes.author: Tim Vince
jokes.text: Last night me and my girlfriend watched three DVDs back to back. Luckily I was the one facing the telly.

jokes.author: Will Marsh
jokes.text: I was raised as an only child which really annoyed my sister.

jokes.author: Rob Beckett
jokes.text: You know you're working class when your TV is bigger than your book case.

jokes.author: Chris Turner
jokes.text: I'm good friends with 25 letters of the alphabet... I don't know Y.

jokes.author: Tim Vine
jokes.text: I took part in the sun tanning Olympics - I just got Bronze.

jokes.author: George Ryegold
jokes.text: Pornography is often frowned upon but that's only because I'm concentrating.

jokes.author: Stewart Francis
jokes.text: I saw a documentary on how ships are kept together. Riveting!

jokes.author: Lou Sanders
jokes.text: I waited an hour for my starter so I complained: 'It's not rocket salad.

jokes.author: Nish Kumar
jokes.text: My mum's so pessimistic that if there was an Olympics for pessimism... she wouldn't fancy her chances.

jokes.author: Nick Helm
jokes.text: I needed a password eight characters long so I picked Snow White and the Seven Dwarves.

jokes.author: Tim Vine
jokes.text: Crime in multi-storey car parks. That is wrong on so many different levels.

jokes.author: Hannibal Buress
jokes.text: People say 'I'm taking it one day at a time'. You know what? So is everybody. That's how time works.

jokes.author: Tim Key
jokes.text: Drive-Thru McDonalds was more expensive than I thought... once you've hired the car...

jokes.author: Matt Kirshen
jokes.text: I was playing chess with my friend and he said 'Let's make this interesting'. So we stopped playing chess.

jokes.author: Sarah Millican
jokes.text: My mother told me you don't have to put anything in your mouth you don't want to. Then she made me eat broccoli which felt like double standards.

jokes.author: Alan Sharp
jokes.text: I was in a band which we called The Prevention because we hoped people would say we were better than The Cure.

jokes.author: Mark Watson
jokes.text: Someone asked me recently - what would I rather give up food or sex. Neither! I'm not falling for that one again wife.

jokes.author: Andrew Lawrence
jokes.text: I admire these phone hackers. I think they have a lot of patience. I can't even be bothered to check my OWN voicemails.

jokes.author: DeAnne Smith
jokes.text: My friend died doing what he loved ... Heroin.

jokes.author: Tim Vine
jokes.text: I've just been on a once-in-a-lifetime holiday. I'll tell you what never again.

jokes.author: David Gibson
jokes.text: I'm currently dating a couple of anorexics. Two birds one stone.

jokes.author: Emo Philips
jokes.text: I picked up a hitch hiker. You've got to when you hit them.

jokes.author: Jack Whitehall
jokes.text: I bought one of those anti-bullying wristbands when they first came out. I say 'bought' I actually stole it off a short fat ginger kid.

jokes.author: Gary Delaney
jokes.text: As a kid I was made to walk the plank. We couldn't afford a dog.

jokes.author: John Bishop
jokes.text: Being an England supporter is like being the over-optimistic parents of the fat kid on sports day.

jokes.author: Bo Burnham
jokes.text: What do you call a kid with no arms and an eyepatch? Names.

jokes.author: Gary Delaney
jokes.text: Dave drowned. So at the funeral we got him a wreath in the shape of a lifebelt. Well it's what he would have wanted.

jokes.author: Robert White
jokes.text: For Vanessa Feltz life is like a box of chocolates: Empty.

jokes.author: Gareth Richards
jokes.text: Wooden spoons are great. You can either use them to prepare food. Or if you can't be bothered with that just write a number on one and walk into a pub...

jokes.author: Dan Antopolski
jokes.text: Hedgehogs - why can't they just share the hedge?

jokes.author: Paddy Lennox
jokes.text: I was watching the London Marathon and saw one runner dressed as a chicken and another runner dressed as an egg. I thought: 'This could be interesting'.

jokes.author: Sarah Millican
jokes.text: I had my boobs measured and bought a new bra. Now I call them Joe Cocker and Jennifer Warnes because they're up where they belong.

jokes.author: Zoe Lyons
jokes.text: I went on a girls' night out recently. The invitation said 'dress to kill'. I went as Rose West.

jokes.author: Jack Whitehal
jokes.text: I'm sure wherever my dad is; he's looking down on us. He's not dead just very condescending.

jokes.author: Adam Hills
jokes.text: Going to Starbucks for coffee is like going to prison for sex. You know you're going to get it but it's going to be rough.

jokes.author: Marcus Brigstocke
jokes.text: To the people who've got iPhones: you just bought one you didn't invent it!

jokes.author: Rhod Gilbert
jokes.text: A spa hotel? It's like a normal hotel only in reception there's a picture of a pebble.

jokes.author: Dan Antopolski
jokes.text: I've been reading the news about there being a civil war in Madagascar. Well I've seen it six times and there isn't.

jokes.author: Simon Brodkin
jokes.text: I started so many fights at my school - I had that attention-deficit disorder. So I didn't finish a lot of them
